snippet: Imports of oil from the kingdom have grown by more than 20 percent this year, leaving the United States vulnerable to tensions in the Persian Gulf.
abstract: United States is increasing its dependence on oil from Saudi Arabia, raising its imports from the kingdom by more than 20 percent in 2012, and leaving it vulnerable to tensions in the Persian Gulf; increase is driven in part by the battle over Iran's nuclear program, with the US tightening sanctions on Iran's ability to sell crude and Saudi Arabia agreeing to increase production to help keep prices stable; conservative and liberal foreign policy experts alike have expressed alarm over the development.
lead_paragraph: Imports of oil from the kingdom have grown by more than 20 percent this year, leaving the United States vulnerable to tensions in the Persian Gulf.

headline.seo: U.S. Reliance on Saudi Oil Is Growing Again
headline.main: U.S. Reliance on Oil From Saudi Arabia Is Growing Again
headline.print_headline: U.S. Reliance On Saudi Oil Goes Back Up
